summary: An email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York (SDNY) to an unspecified recipient, discussing coordination and payment to a vendor (Melkin Solutions) to scan 28 Epstein-related boxes held in the Southern District of Florida (SDFL). The email seeks permission for the vendor to take the boxes off-site for faster processing.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: Author of the email, coordinating the scanning of 28 Epstein-related boxes from SDFL by vendor Melkin Solutions, seeking expedited access.

events.title: Coordination for scanning Epstein boxes
events.description: An AUSA from SDNY emails to coordinate scanning of 28 Epstein-related boxes held in SDFL by vendor Melkin Solutions, seeking permission for off-site processing.
personsInvolved: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York

keyFacts: 28 Epstein-related boxes were held in the Southern District of Florida (SDFL) as of September 2020.
The Southern District of New York (SDNY) budget office approved payment to Melkin Solutions to scan these boxes.
The vendor, Melkin Solutions, requested to take the boxes to their office for faster processing, requiring coordination and permission.
The email indicates an ongoing effort to digitize Epstein case materials for investigation or discovery purposes.
